I COULD'NT FEEL A CONNECTION TO PARTS OF THIS SERIES BECAUSE I WAS AN ENLISTED MAN DURING THE KOREAN WAR,  I WAS ON A SHIP IN 1951THAT ESCORTED THE CARRIERS.  I ALSO SERVED ON SHIPS THAT SUPPORTED THE BLOCADE. .  THE EPISODES THAT WERE MADE AT SEA WERE OUTSTANDING AND TRUE TO LIFE. DURING MY TIMES IN PORT, WE WERE IN THE BACKWATERS OF ASIA.  ANYONE WHO SERVED IN THE OPERATIONS DIVISION WILL ENJOY THIS SERIES TO THE FULLEST.  OFFICERS SHOULD FIND THIS SERIES OUTSTANDING.

In what other series could you find Navy ships, sailors, SEALS, subs, Navy planes, a female marine, and JAG lawyers to boot? I'm so glad the producers have kept the same characters for five seasons. They are wonderful together or on their own in any scene. The new "gunny" is a great addition to the cast. By the way, the actress who played Harriet did some unforgettable acting as Phyllis Diller in the episode "Ghosts of Christmas Past." Way to go, JAG! Keep it coming.

Another great season.  Relationships are explored in greater depth.  I loved the show and I loved the way what happened on the show reflected the climate in the military of the time.

You might also. Vary good cast. A lot of action not just courtroom stuff. Try any episode and you will see what i did.

this is one of my favorite seasons. i really liked the romance of mac and her aussie. knowing the actor died made it a little sad but i really liked this season. the best is yet to come. when harm adopts and becomes a parent he seems more real to me. so now i must get the next season..
This is a great continuation of JAG. Bought it for my daughter who loves JAG.

I didn't watch Jag until it was in the 10th season. Recently I caught it on TV reruns and got totally hooked. I had to get the DVD's. Needless to say I LOVE Harm Rabb, he couldn't be any cuter. Season two brought Catherine Bell on the scene as Harm's Partner. I love the immediate chemistry between them and the looks Harm gives her...my heart swoons. The love is there for sure now but they cannot act on it.

I didn't think it would keep getting better and better but what can I say it does. Season 5 is no dissapointment. I love how it is current with the year it was made as far as what wars are going on.

I think watching this also makes us remember our troops more and all they are doing for us. We can sit and enjoy watching DVD's safe in our homes because they are protecting and defending our freedom.

The adventures are so varied and different in each show. Season two has more courtroom time it's investigations and drama.

I cannot say enough good about this show. You will not be disappointed.
This Series is great for all the fans of jag out there and i cant wait till the next great season comes out
Good clear DVD's.  The show is excellent and I'm sorry it was canceled.  Having the DVD sets helps me to remember what a good program "Jag" was.

Jag was, and is, such a great series.  The actors are impeccable with each person getting a chance to shine.  The writing is fantastic and really well thought out. I love dramas that have to do with the military and this series does not disappoint.  All of the actors, at some point, get a chance to shine.  Even though the series seemed to be mostly focused on Harm and Mac (David James Elliott and Catherine Bell), each character is given a chance to have a storyline.  I watched the show when it was on tv originally and I am so glad that they have released it on DVD.  Very good series.

As with other JAG season episodes, Season 6 was interesting and entertaining. The depiction of the NAVY and JAG is realistic while providing entertainment value worth viewing. I recommend this season to all.

Howard (Hutch) Hutchison
JAG is always GREAT and so is this DVD  what else is there to say
JAG speaks for itself . . . over and over, never to let you down!
JAG (Judge Advocate General) - The Fifth Season Great series. I enjoy watching these programs.

JAG Season 5 offers great variety in character interactions and sets the stage for future seasons.  Harm's realization that Naval Aviation is not in his career future is a cathartic event in the series.  Mac's appearance in a bikini (presumably topless) is a cardiac event.  Brumby is at his best as a pest for Harm (rest his soul).  Altogether, it is an excellent way to spend some quality time (particularly for JAG fans).
A Fantastic 5th Season , Would Recommend Purchase To Anyone! , Great Series!!!  William A. Croce
This is one of the best series that was ever on TV. David James Elliot and Catherine Bell are perfectly matched.
If you are a Jag Fan, such as my husband and myself, this disc set is for you.

Incredible!!  I have purchased 4 seasons of JAG and they just get better. I enjoy it as much as when it was current TV years ago.  The Fifth Season was a wonderful time for the show in that Mic was introduced and Mac and Harm revealed their intimate feelings for each other (limited, of course).  It is a shame that a show of this caliber was discontinued.  It actually, in addition to being great viewing, has given me a better perspective and respect for the military and the job they do.  I know this is "only" TV, but some of the episodes represent activities that actually happen and portrays the "real" role served by the military forces of our great country. I hope the talent of David James Bell and others on the show is not being wasted.

For the first time they released the 5 season of Jag in Widescreen format only, I think they should have relesed it in both formats. the Six season which will be released on 5/20/08 is going to be released in both formats according to amazon's listing of it.

I have purchased Seasons 1-5 of JAG. Season 5 is, in my opinion, by far the best of these. Season 1 is exciting but occasionally overstretches, and Season 2 has an ill-matched partner for Harm (and...wait...aren't these guys lawyers?...there isn't a courtroom in sight!). In Season 3 Mac and other regulars comes on board but it takes a while for the actors to seem settled into their roles, Season 4 is getting better, and Season 5 is pretty darn awesome. The courtroom battles are diverse and raise interesting issues without being too preachy (unfulfilled promises from a recruiter, an overweight sailor who only flies a computer but is threatened with dishonorable discharge, an over-tired aviator who fails to bring in a fellow aviator safely, Harm is framed for Clinton-bashing...). The development of romantic relationships, especially Mic's and Mac's, is really enjoyable -- especially the always simmering hostility between Harm and Mic, and the unexpectedly frank, brief conversation between Harm and Mac about their own relationship). And a two-episode location shoot in Australia! As far as I recall, Season 6 was pretty darn good too, but for what's available now, Season 5 will stand up best to repeat viewing.

So why 4 stars? Where's the bonus features?! Come on, folks, not a single commentary? Not a single interview? The only "bonus" is a gag reel -- and I swear it's under 4 minutes. (I meant to double-check before writing this, but I'm pretty sure it was 3-something minutes.) Disappointing.

I am out to sea for months at a time on board a NOAA Ship.  It is nice to watch a TV show that I enjoyed when it was on the Air.  This was something I did with my boys and watching this makes me feel like I am home with them.  Thank You and Look forword to more of the seasons of JAG and NCIS.
I found this season to be a little boring.  Don't get me wrong I love JAG but...I grow tired of CDR. Brumby wooing Mac.

This as all of the other Jag's continues to wave the flag through dedication and perserverance to the country.  The episode, where Harm pushed the other Tomcat was another testimony of the type of men and women who are in the defense of our country.  It is too bad Jag went off the air, but, Jag lives on and will live on in the hearts and minds of those who have served, myself included, in the defense of this great nation.  Jag is a reminder of all that is good in this country.  I look forward to the future editions.  God bless the United States of America.
Excellent DVD Collection if you liked the JAG TV Series, especially if you missed some episodes from Season 5.

The first season lacked a bit, but it has definitely improved with time.  The characters are great. Enjoy the relationships. One of the things I like best about this serious is that it portrays the military in a favorable light...as the heroes that they are. It is refreshing.  Some of the dialogue is a little cheesy and the plots a little predictable, but overall very enjoyable.

This was one of the best shows on TV until S9 and S10.  It is a shame it did not get the credit and awards that lesser shows received.  S5 was one of the best seasons and S6 to be released in May is at the top of the list.  Paramount is being very stingy with extras.  Since there was a 7th DVD is this set due to there being 25 episodes they really could have had more than 3 minutes of bloopers or maybe put in some unused scenes.
I really enjoy JAG (Judge Advocate General) - The Fifth Season and look forward to checking out the Sixth Season when it is offered.

This is a continuation of the fine production of this great series.  Video and Sound Quality is the best.  It's reallly great to see the shows without the commercials.  The GAG Reel on this set is pretty cool.
JAG is one of my favorite older series.  I was thrilled to be able to get all the seasons from Amazon.

This show rules!!! I still don't know why it did not go to a 10th season.  I would have liked to see Captain Rabb in action.  Now we wait for season six.  Probably one of the best shows on TV, in the 1990 to 2005 range.  Lasted through many storms.  Always a good cast, and up to date.  I have all 5 seasons so far.  Great show!
If you are a fan of JAG then this is DVD set is a great edition. The set includes a small reel of bloopers but other than that there aren't any extras.
This was one of the best series on tv, can't wait for the rest to be reliesed.

I've watched JAG on TV for quite some time, and this christmas my parents bought me JAG Seasons 1 through 4. I've been watching them just about every day for 4 or 5 hours. If you like Military genre shows then JAG will appeal to you. I especially love the episodes dealing with USN SEALS. I would of given it 5 stars, but only 4 simply because I found it annoying that the producers of the DVD didn't put much thought into the production. There are no chapter selections, no alternate languages, and no special scenes like commentary and cut scenes etc. I understand that Season 5 has a Gag reel. I intend to buy it this month.
I will also continue to purchase Jag on dvd. I have purchased season 5 and cannot wait until season 6 is released now . I never get tired of the shows!

I didn't watch Jag until it was in the 10th season. Recently I caught it on TV reruns and got totally hooked. I had to get the DVD's. Needless to say I LOVE Harm Rabb, he couldn't be any cuter. The love is there for sure now but they cannot act on it.

I didn't think it would keep getting better and better but what can I say it does. Season 5 is no dissapointment. I love how it is current with the year it was made as far as what wars are going on.

I think watching this also makes us remember our troops more and all they are doing for us. We can sit and enjoy watching DVD's safe in our homes because they are protecting and defending our freedom.

Jag was, and is, such a great series.  The actors are impeccable with each person getting a chance to shine.  The writing is fantastic and really well thought out. I love dramas that have to do with the military and this series does not disappoint.  All of the actors, at some point, get a chance to shine.  Even though the series seemed to be mostly focused on Harm and Mac (David James Elliott and Catherine Bell), each character is given a chance to have a storyline.  I watched the show when it was on tv originally and I am so glad that they have released it on DVD.  Very good series.

JAG Season 5 offers great variety in character interactions and sets the stage for future seasons.  Harm's realization that Naval Aviation is not in his career future is a cathartic event in the series.  Mac's appearance in a bikini (presumably topless) is a cardiac event.  Brumby is at his best as a pest for Harm (rest his soul).  Altogether, it is an excellent way to spend some quality time (particularly for JAG fans).

Incredible!!  I have purchased 4 seasons of JAG and they just get better. I enjoy it as much as when it was current TV years ago.  The Fifth Season was a wonderful time for the show in that Mic was introduced and Mac and Harm revealed their intimate feelings for each other (limited, of course).  It is a shame that a show of this caliber was discontinued.  It actually, in addition to being great viewing, has given me a better perspective and respect for the military and the job they do.  I know this is "only" TV, but some of the episodes represent activities that actually happen and portrays the "real" role served by the military forces of our great country. I hope the talent of David James Bell and others on the show is not being wasted.

For the first time they released the 5 season of Jag in Widescreen format only, I think they should have relesed it in both formats. the Six season which will be released on 5/20/08 is going to be released in both formats according to amazon's listing of it.

I have purchased Seasons 1-5 of JAG. Season 5 is, in my opinion, by far the best of these. Season 1 is exciting but occasionally overstretches, and Season 2 has an ill-matched partner for Harm (and...wait...aren't these guys lawyers?...there isn't a courtroom in sight!). In Season 3 Mac and other regulars comes on board but it takes a while for the actors to seem settled into their roles, Season 4 is getting better, and Season 5 is pretty darn awesome. The courtroom battles are diverse and raise interesting issues without being too preachy (unfulfilled promises from a recruiter, an overweight sailor who only flies a computer but is threatened with dishonorable discharge, an over-tired aviator who fails to bring in a fellow aviator safely, Harm is framed for Clinton-bashing...). The development of romantic relationships, especially Mic's and Mac's, is really enjoyable -- especially the always simmering hostility between Harm and Mic, and the unexpectedly frank, brief conversation between Harm and Mac about their own relationship). And a two-episode location shoot in Australia! As far as I recall, Season 6 was pretty darn good too, but for what's available now, Season 5 will stand up best to repeat viewing.

So why 4 stars? Where's the bonus features?! Come on, folks, not a single commentary? Not a single interview? The only "bonus" is a gag reel -- and I swear it's under 4 minutes. (I meant to double-check before writing this, but I'm pretty sure it was 3-something minutes.) Disappointing.

I am out to sea for months at a time on board a NOAA Ship.  It is nice to watch a TV show that I enjoyed when it was on the Air.  This was something I did with my boys and watching this makes me feel like I am home with them.  Thank You and Look forword to more of the seasons of JAG and NCIS.

This as all of the other Jag's continues to wave the flag through dedication and perserverance to the country.  The episode, where Harm pushed the other Tomcat was another testimony of the type of men and women who are in the defense of our country.  It is too bad Jag went off the air, but, Jag lives on and will live on in the hearts and minds of those who have served, myself included, in the defense of this great nation.  Jag is a reminder of all that is good in this country.  I look forward to the future editions.  God bless the United States of America.

Some of the dialogue is a little cheesy and the plots a little predictable, but overall very enjoyable.

I've watched JAG on TV for quite some time, and this christmas my parents bought me JAG Seasons 1 through 4. I've been watching them just about every day for 4 or 5 hours. If you like Military genre shows then JAG will appeal to you. I especially love the episodes dealing with USN SEALS. I would of given it 5 stars, but only 4 simply because I found it annoying that the producers of the DVD didn't put much thought into the production. There are no chapter selections, no alternate languages, and no special scenes like commentary and cut scenes etc. I understand that Season 5 has a Gag reel. I intend to buy it this month.
